Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida  
Piratini, March 21, 1841.

With pleasure I received your esteemed letter dated the 15th of this month, which pleased me greatly to know that you enjoyed good health and had made a successful journey; I informed the other gentlemen mentioned in the same letter; presently there is no news here except for the report that Silva intends to pass through. On Thursday, the six sons of Dona Joaquina do Pavão and an old man named Rolim were captured in Pelotas. I inform you that with the departure of Your Excellency, Sir, and Your Excellency José Mariano not giving any provision, I am many more we will not receive; I am convinced that this gentleman acts against the orders of the government, according to the decrees and circulars that exist on the matter. A few days ago Your Excellency wrote to Your Excellency Erval and I hope he will provide a prompt remedy. My family commends themselves very much to you and I, in particular, do so for being

From Your Excellency  
Antônio José de Abreu

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida, Minister of Finance Affairs.  
[On the verso] São Gabriel.

Answered on April 11.
